message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this fantastic product at a price that I think is very competitive. I'm willing to sell it to you for $14000.
I appreciate your offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $12000. Would you be willing to meet me at that price?

I appreciate your interest in the product, Bob! However, I'm afraid I'm not comfortable going as low as $12000. I'm willing to meet you halfway, so I'm counteroffering at $13500. Let me know if that's something you'd be interested in.
I understand that you're willing to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit above my budget. Would you be willing to go down to $13000?

I can see you're really interested in the product, Bob, but I'm not quite ready to meet you at $13000 yet. I'm willing to come down a bit further, so I'm counteroffering at $13250. Let me know if that's something you'd be willing to consider.
I appreciate your willingness to come down further, but I'm still a bit above my budget. Would you be willing to meet me at $12800?

I'm starting to get a bit concerned that we're getting close to the minimum price I'm willing to accept, Bob. However, I'm willing to make one more concession. I'm counteroffering at $13000, which is the same price I offered in Round 4. Let's see if we can meet in the middle this time.
I understand that you're getting close to your minimum price, but I'm still a bit above my budget. Would you be willing to meet me at $12900?

I'm getting close to my minimum price, Bob, and I'm not sure how much more I'm willing to budge. However, I'm willing to make one final concession. I'm counteroffering at $13200. This is as low as I'm willing to go. Let's see if we can finally meet on a price.
I appreciate your willingness to make one final concession, but I'm afraid I'm still a bit above my budget. I'm going to have to pass on this deal. I think I'll look elsewhere for a better price.
